Overview:

Princeton University is seeking a Senior Developer/System Administrator with advanced expertise in the ServiceNow Security domain, particularly in Vulnerability Response, Information Risk Management (IRM), and Security Operations (SecOps). This role will be an integral part of the Service Management Office (SMO) within the Office of Information Technology (OIT). The SMO provides leadership and direction to ensure that OIT's services continually meet customer needs and add value to the University. The senior developer/system administrator will collaborate closely with SMO colleagues, Information Security Office, and OIT stakeholders to comprehend business requirements and leverage the ServiceNow platform to design, develop, and configure solutions that align with the security-focused program needs.

The position will entail maintaining the stability and usability of the ServiceNow platform, including regular application maintenance, incident support, and contributions to ServiceNow software releases, all while adhering to security best practices.

As a senior member of the team, the developer/administrator will provide expert consultation to the SMO support team and ensure the ServiceNow platform aligns with business strategies and governance decisions. They will also be responsible for documenting the platform, conducting impact assessments for new requirements, and establishing controls to ensure the correct technical solutions are implemented for business solutions. Overall, the senior developer/administrator must possess advanced knowledge and skills in the ServiceNow Security domain, as well as a deep understanding of the business strategy and policies governing the ServiceNow platform.

A remote work arrangement within the United States may be considered for candidates with the appropriate background and experience. University-paid business travel to Princeton, NJ may be required approximately 2-4 times per year.

Responsibilities:

System Development:

 * Design and develop new ServiceNow applications and services with a focus on Vulnerability Response, IRM, and SecOps.
 * Make recommendations and actively participate in implementing new ServiceNow requirements related to security and compliance.
 * Take ownership of complex security-related business requirements and work towards their successful implementation.
 * Provide architectural controls and conduct impact analysis for new security-related requirements.
 * Continuously identify opportunities for improving security processes and solutions, including the consolidation of similar security needs.
 * Collaborate with the team to implement technical best practices, policies, and procedures in the Security domain.
 * Contribute to ServiceNow software releases by configuring security-related features and functionality.
 * Collaborate effectively with team members to design and implement optimal solutions for security-related technical challenges.

System Architecture:

 * Research and stay current with ServiceNow Security products and relevant integrated technologies.
 * Create and maintain a detailed view of the ServiceNow architecture, emphasizing security components.
 * Align the ServiceNow platform's security capabilities with established business security strategies.
 * Assist with estimating release-level effort, ensuring security-related aspects are considered.

System Administration:

 * Optimize the stability and usability of ServiceNow from a security perspective through regular application maintenance.
 * Provide day-to-day operational support and timely resolution of security-related tickets and incidents.

Qualifications:
Essential Qualifications:
 * A minimum of 5 years of experience developing technology solutions (Utah or later versions).
 * A minimum of 3 years working as a ServiceNow application developer/system administrator with a focus on security.
 * Extensive experience in enterprise security and architecture, including knowledge of various authentication systems.
 * Strong background in IT service management with an emphasis on security.
 * Advanced knowledge of ServiceNow administration and demonstrated experience in developing ServiceNow applications in the Security domain.
 * Experience with database design schemas and data modeling for security purposes.
 * Proficiency in working with business analysts to translate security requirements into technical solutions.
 * Experience with middleware and discovery technologies for security enhancement.
 * Demonstrated expertise with ServiceNow's incident, change, problem, request, CMDB, and knowledge management applications.
 * Expertise in JavaScript and Web Services development languages, particularly in the context of security.
 * Proficiency in Windows and Linux system administration, including shell scripting.
 * Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
 * ServiceNow Certified Developer with experience in writing scoped applications for enhanced security.
 * Expert knowledge of AngularJS, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS development languages for designing secure user interfaces.
 * Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing ITSM/ITIL software solutions with a strong focus on security.
 * Proven ability to integrate ServiceNow with other systems using Web Services and scripting to enhance security measures.

Platform and Project Leadership Responsibilities

OCTO is looking for a Senior ServiceNow Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing solutions within the ServiceNow platform. 

As a Senior ServiceNow Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing solutions within the ServiceNow platform. You will be responsible for maintaining and performing continual service improvements on the following implemented modules: ITSM, ITFM, HRSD, ITOM, PPM, and SPM. You will be expected to collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.

Work with product owner/stakeholders to build requested items and tasks using workflows to manage processes and meet business requirements.

Document and maintain functional business requirements, process flows and business use cases.

Performs operational administrative tasks, as needed.

Assists with report configuration and maintenance, as needed.

Configure and maintain data integrations between ServiceNow and other systems.

Design/ Develop ServiceNow Forms and Tables as well as Modules.

Develop Workflow / Flow Design where required to drive Approvals and Process Lifecycle.

Design, create and configure Business Rules, UI Policies, UI Actions, Client Scripts and ACLs including advanced scripting of each (including CMS/Service Portal).

Design, create and configure Notifications, UI Pages, UI Macros, Script Includes, Formatters, etc. in ServiceNow.

Best Practices and Governance:

Ensure adherence to ServiceNow best practices, agency security guidelines, governance policies and maintain as close to an out of the box environment as possible.
Perform code reviews and mentor junior developers.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated on ServiceNow releases, features, and industry trends.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or equivalent work experience.

ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD) or Certified Implementation Specialist(CIS) certification highly desired

Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with ServiceNow development of the modules listed above.

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.

Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and REST APIs.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Possess an in-depth knowledge of implementing ServiceNow Architecture and ServiceNow Scripting.

Experience creating ServiceNow update sets, promoting and testing through multiple instances and into production.

Demonstrated knowledge of service management processes, procedures, and software, and including knowledge of ServiceNow.

---------------------------------------------

CONTRACT JOB DESCRIPTION

Responsibilities:

1. Designs, develops, enhances, debugs, and implements software.

2. Troubleshoots production problems related to software applications.

3. Researches, tests, build, and coordinate the conversion and/or integration of new products based on client requirements.

4. Designs and develops new software products or major enhancements to existing software.

5. Addresses problems of systems integration, compatibility, and multiple platforms.

6. Consults with project teams and end users to identify application requirements.

7. Performs feasibility analysis on potential future projects to management.

8. Assists in the evaluation and recommendation of application software packages, application integration and testing tools.

9. Resolves problems with software and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.

10. Acts as team leader on projects.

11. Instructs, assigns, directs, and checks the work of other software developers on development team.

12. Participates in development of software user manuals.

Job Description:

As a Senior ServiceNow Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing solutions within the ServiceNow platform. You will be responsible for maintaining and performing continual service improvements on the following implemented modules: ITSM, ITFM, HRSD, ITOM, PPM, and SPM. You will be expected to collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Work with product owner/stakeholders to build requested items and tasks using workflows to manage processes and meet business requirements. Document and maintain functional business requirements, process flows and business use cases. Performs operational administrative tasks, as needed. Assists with report configuration and maintenance, as needed. Configure and maintain data integrations between ServiceNow and other systems. Design/ Develop ServiceNow Forms and Tables as well as Modules. Develop Workflow / Flow Design where required to drive Approvals and Process Lifecycle. Design, create and configure Business Rules, UI Policies, UI Actions, Client Scripts and ACLs including advanced scripting of each (including CMS/Service Portal). Design, create and configure Notifications, UI Pages, UI Macros, Script Includes, Formatters, etc. in ServiceNow.

Best Practices and Governance: Ensure adherence to ServiceNow best practices, agency security guidelines, governance policies and maintain as close to an out of the box environment as possible.
Perform code reviews and mentor junior developers.

Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on ServiceNow releases, features, and industry trends.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or equivalent work experience. ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD) or Certified Implementation Specialist(CIS) certification highly desired Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with ServiceNow development of the modules listed above. Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment. Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and REST APIs.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Possess an in-depth knowledge of implementing ServiceNow Architecture and ServiceNow Scripting. Experience creating ServiceNow update sets, promoting and testing through multiple instances and into production. Demonstrated knowledge of service management processes, procedures, and software, and including knowledge of ServiceNow.

Responsibilities:
1. Designs, develops, enhances, debugs, and implements software.
2. Troubleshoots production problems related to software applications.
3. Researches, tests, build, and coordinate the conversion and/or integration of new products based on client requirements.
4. Designs and develops new software products or major enhancements to existing software.
5. Addresses problems of systems integration, compatibility, and multiple platforms.
6. Consults with project teams and end users to identify application requirements.
7. Performs feasibility analysis on potential future projects to management.
8. Assists in the evaluation and recommendation of application software packages, application integration and testing tools.
9. Resolves problems with software and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.
10. Acts as team leader on projects.
11. Instructs, assigns, directs, and checks the work of other software developers on development team.
12. Participates in development of software user manuals.

job_title: Global ITSM ServiceNow Developer and Administrator
job_description:
Overview:
Mayer Brown is an international law firm positioned to represent the world’s major corporations, funds, and financial institutions in their most important and complex transactions and disputes. We are recognized by our clients as strategic partners with deep commercial instincts and a commitment to creatively anticipating their needs and delivering excellence in everything we do.


We are a collegial, collaborative, and diverse firm where highly motivated individuals with an unwavering commitment to excellence receive the opportunity, support, and development they need to grow, thrive, and realize their greatest potential all while supporting the Firm’s client service principles of excellence, strategic partnership, commercial instinct, integrated strengths, innovation, and collaboration across our international firm.


If you enjoy working with team members whose defining characteristics are achievement, initiative, professionalism, responsiveness, and adaptability, you may be the person we are seeking to join our Information Technology department in our Chicago office as a Global ITSM ServiceNow Developer and Administrator.



The ITSM ServiceNow Developer and Administrator provides application technical expertise for the installation and support of all IT Service Management (ITSM) software application tools. Responsible for the design, configuration and administration of vendor or in-house developed applications or scripts required to support the IT Service Management platform solution; including integrations into and out of ITSM tools and Enterprise applications. Responsible for developing repeatable processes using the appropriate Orchestration automation utilities to enhance the flexibility and value of the ITSM Solution. Serves as the Subject Matter Expert to configure IT Service Management User Interface (UI) to meet the requirements of the defined Business process needs for Incident, Change, Configuration, Release, Problem and Request Management. Ensures appropriate communication, testing, and adherence to ITSM processes are met.




Responsibilities:

Essential Functions:

 * Provides technical expertise and collaboration with the Global Assistant Director of IT Operations, Application owners, Infrastructure, Customer Services and Process Managers
 * Provides on-going technical assistance and software configuration/customization to include screen tailoring, workflow administration, report setup, dashboards, data imports, LDAP integration, custom scripting, and third party software integrations
 * Troubleshoots and resolves moderately complex and unique system problems, failures and issues.
 * Manages application deployments through the appropriate use of Import sets and Update sets in accordance with agreed upon release schedules
 * Develops and maintains queries against Microsoft SQL databases such as Microsoft SQL, to prepare reporting statistics (KPIs), status reports and trends on current and historical data connected with and related to production Configuration Items
 * Develops and supports Application integrations across the infrastructure including, but not limited to, the Configuration Management Database
 * Manages the configuration and maintenance of all supporting application infrastructure, including but not limited to, application servers, database servers and integration servers
 * Performs other duties as assigned as required to meet Firm goals and objectives



Qualifications:
Education/Training/Certifications:
 * Bachelor’s degree in a related field. An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered in lieu of the degree when the experience has been directly related to the functions of the job is preferred
 * ITIL v3 Foundations certification minimum is a requirement




Professional Experience:
 * Minimum of three (3) years knowledge and experience supporting enterprise applications or IT Service Management Administration or three (3) years supporting enterprise infrastructures is required
 * Working experience with Workflow and Approval configuration is required



Technical Skills:
 * Proficient working with ServiceNow components such as Service Catalog, Change/Incident/Problem Management, Asset Management, Discovery and Knowledge management is a requirement
 * A solid understanding of a Configuration Management Database (CMDB) and its relationship to asset management and IT service management processes is required
 * Experience working with technical ServiceNow components such as: business rules, client scripts, UI policies and actions, UI pages and macros, script includes, catalog items, workflows, web services and reports is a requirement
 * Experience with working or developing in the following programming languages: HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, JavaScript API, Client and Server-side Scripting, ServiceNow API's, Web Services is preferred
 * Working knowledge of the ITSM/ ITIL Framework required
 * Working knowledge of ITIL principles and experience applying ITIL guidance to IT service teams required
 * Working knowledge of ServiceNow best practices and ongoing knowledge of latest ServiceNow features preferred
 * Working experience with ServiceNow automated discovery tool required
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Office products required



Performance Traits:
 * Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to communicate effectively and in a professional manner with all levels of the Firm and outside vendors
 * Ability to work in a diverse team environment and effectively support the demanding needs of the Firm
 * Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines with shifting priorities
 * Must be a self-starter with a high level of initiative
 * Strong customer service skills, able to anticipate needs and exercise independent judgment
 * Strong attention to detail, organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects
 * Maintains confidentiality and exercises discretion
 * Exercises solid strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
 * Strong oral and written communications skills
 * Committed to continued advancement
 * Resilient and able to handle setbacks
 * Commitment to process improvement
 * Familiarity with established project management and other structured operational practices
 * High level of discretion, comfortable handling sensitive information and maintaining confidentiality
 * Ability to manage time and prioritize workloads effectively
 * Willingness to challenge the status quo



Physical Requirements:
 * May require occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs



The above is a general description of the essential duties associated with this position and does not represent an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all duties.


The Firm may modify and amend this job description at any time at its sole discretion. Nothing herein creates a contract of employment or otherwise modifies the at-will nature of employment.


We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits, including medical/dental/vision/life/and AD&D insurance, 401 (k) savings plan, back-up childcare and eldercare, generous paid time off (PTO), as well as opportunities for professional development and growth.


Thank you for your interest in Mayer Brown. We are committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities and disabled veterans. To request a reasonable accommodation related to the application process and/or job interview, please email uslateralrecruiting@mayerbrown.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

ROLE: SERVICENOW SENIOR DEVELOPER

LOCATION: CHICAGO (MUST BE ABLE TO WORK ONSITE 3 DAYS/WEEK)


ABOUT US:

Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, redefining our clients' Business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, Consultative approach helps envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, and is consistently listed among The most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com.


ABOUT OUR SERVICENOW PRACTICE:

Cognizant's Now Practice expands the entire platform beyond traditional implementations into strategic digital transformations. Our validated ability to assess, innovate, design, build, integrate and sustain opportunities keeps the client’s main goals top of mind while ensuring businesses stay relevant, brands are differentiated and profitable growth is achieved. We have successfully led over 9,500 transformations – delivering services globally and across the enterprise. We are a Global Elite Partner and product-line certified in all 9 ServiceNow domains across the platform. We have received the highest-tier certification from ServiceNow, Product Line Achievement, based on both our capability and the consistent and high satisfaction of our customers. We have twice won the ServiceNow Hackathon for innovation, named # 1 for Voice of the Customer by HFS Research and twice recognized since 2021 as NOW Partner of the Year. Our tenure and confirmed achievements make Cognizant a front runner to propose dedicated approaches on the NOW platform.

Summary of Position: ServiceNow Senior Developer-Chicago

As a ServiceNow Senior Developer will be responsible for executing specific technical tasks, serving as technical support, interfacing directly with client solutions and enterprise architects, and assisting to create standardization of technology methodologies, approaches and deliverables.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * MUST BE ABLE TO WORK ONSITE 3 DAYS/WEEK IN CHICAGO OFFICE
 * Responsible for day-to-day development related activities during project including writing code.
 * Participates in regular peer code reviews to ensure high-quality and low defect outcomes.
 * Regularly collaborate with QA and Client testing resources during UAT.
 * Documents describing the configurations performed as needed for every sprint.
 * Provides suggestions and alternatives to technical challenges to meet business solutions.
 * Assists in compiling client work including client approach documents and proposals under the direction of the Engagement Leadership Team.
 * Maintains ServiceNow certifications with the latest delta exams.
 * Achieves additional certifications as needed.


KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:

 * 5+ years experience as a ServiceNow platform developer within multiple modules.
 * Demonstrable skills with integrations between ServiceNow and third-party applications.
 * Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 * Strong problem solving and data analysis skills.
 * Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products.

EDUCATION & WORK EXPERIENCE

 * 3-5 years of related experience in ServiceNow, programming JavaScript, configuring complex integrations, and configuring Service Portals.
 * Hands-on ServiceNow experience meeting client requirements.
 * Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management, Information Systems or related discipline preferred.


WORK AUTHORIZATION

job_title: ServiceNow Administrator & Developer III (Hybrid & Remote Work Eligible)
job_description:
SNC supports programs and warriors who protect our country. Be part of the team that helps protect our country.

SNC is a dynamic, state-of-the-art company with a very dynamic ServiceNow platform environment.

The ServiceNow Architect is responsible for the health and ongoing maintenance of the ServiceNow platform. This includes platform maintenance/upgrades, and overseeing the design and implementation of all small enhancements and project-related transformational changes to the platform. This includes overseeing the work performed by internal ServiceNow CSAs, citizen developers, and 3rd-party System Integrators.

Sierra Nevada Corporation’s ServiceNow Platform team designs, implements, and supports services and offerings in the IT Service Management, ITOM, and Human Resources Management spaces as well as supports shared development spaces in the GRC and Security Operation’s spaces.
This ServiceNow Architect a technical subject management expert responsible for the architecture, design, development, administration, and rollout of solutions on the ServiceNow platform.

The ServiceNow Architect will work with internal customers, Scrum Masters, Technical Product Managers, ServiceNow developers, and 3rd parties to design, develop, test, and deploy enhancements, fixes, integrations, and configuration changes needed to support the enterprise.



As SNC's corporate team, we provide the company and its business areas with strategic direction and business support spanning executive management, finance and accounting, operations, human resources, legal, IT, information security, facilities, marketing, and communications. Learn more about SNC's Corporate team



Responsibilities:

 * Ensure the health, safety, and performance of the platform by ensure all changes to all modules within the platform are designed within CSDM best practices.

 * Oversee all design work within the platform related to project work performed internally and by 3rd parties, internal small enhancements, and citizen development activities.

 * Perform development and configuration of a variety of areas including, but not limited to Service Portal, Service Catalog, Incident, Problem, Change, Knowledge, Release / SDLC, ITAM / Asset Management, ITOM / CMDB Discovery & Service Mapping, Human Resource (HR) Management, GRC/IRM, Vulnerability Response/Management, Customer Service Management (CSM) external portals, Mobility and Reporting.

 * Provide design support and development to, but not limited to screen tailoring, workflow administration, flow administration, report setup, data imports, integration, scripting, third party software integrations, automation, and custom application development.

 * Scope and design solutions and/or integrations for documented business and technical needs, with an emphasis on / preference for minimizing customization.

 * Design technical solutions to address complex requirements, evaluate alternate solutions, identify the best option, and implement the solution. Design, develop and configure workflows, forms, scripts, and underlying logic using Scrum / Agile methodologies.

 * Maintain our SDLC processes for unit, system integration, regression, and user acceptance testing.

 * Perform evaluation and rollout of new applications and solutions in ServiceNow both proactively and as requested.

 * Design, build, rollout and support the technical framework to support a ‘Citizen Development’ shared development strategy.

 * Oversee all platform version and patch upgrades along with related clone downs.



Must Haves:

 * Computer Science or related field bachelor’s degree.

 * Six (6) or more years of relevant experience.
   
   * A higher-level degree may substitute for experience.
   
   * Related experience may be considered in lieu of required education.

 * Certified ServiceNow Administrator (CSA).

 * Wide and deep understanding of the ServiceNow platform.

 * Experience implementing ITSM processes including Service Portals and Service Catalog items.

 * Experience in at least 2 additional ServiceNow modules (See Preferred below).

 * Experience using standard ‘Requirements Gathering’ techniques resulting in high customer satisfaction for the services that are eventually delivered.

 * Experience implementing multiple ITSM services including Service Catalog work related to form design, approvals, and workflows.

 * Good understanding of Common Services Data Model (CSDM) good practices and experience implementing CSDM-aligned ServiceNow solutions.

 * Excellent written & verbal communication and documentation skills.

 * Subject matter expertise and the ability to lead, guide and mentor others.



Preferred:

 * Certified ServiceNow Developer or Certified ServiceNow Implementation Specialist.

 * ITIL v3 and/or v4 Certifications.

 * Experience implementing multiple ServiceNow modules including:
   
   * IT Asset Management (ITAM), SAM PRO, HAM PRO.
   
   * IT Operations Management (ITOM), CMDB Discovery, Service Mapping.
   
   * Human Resources Management (HR).
   
   * Governance Risk & Compliance (GRC) / Integrated Risk Management (IRM).
   
   * Vulnerability Response / Management (VR / VM).
   
   * Customer Service Management (CSM).
   
   * Certificate Management.
   
   * Generative AI and AIOps service offerings.

 * Relevant software development certifications.

 * Micro Certs or certifications in other platform functionalities.



At Sierra Nevada Corporation (SNC) we deliver customer-focused technology and best-of-breed integrations in the aerospace and defense sectors. ServBeyond Solutions’ dedication to innovation, quality and customer satisfaction has allowed us to become a well-recognized leader in providing digital services for our Government customers. We seek an experienced Sr. ServiceNow Developer who can contribute to our customer success.




The Digital Modernization Sector has a career opportunity for a ServiceNow Developer supporting the Global Solutions Management – Operations II (GSM-O II) contract at DISA. This contract includes the Operations, Sustainment, Maintenance, Repair, and Defense of the Defense Information System Network (DISN) within the DOD Information Network (DODIN) in support of the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA). It also includes support to other key tasks for DISA, including the transformation of DISA’s operational mission through innovation, and support to DISA’s mission partners.

As ServiceNow Developer you will perform configuration, development, support, and maintenance of the ServiceNow implementation. Works with external and internal stakeholders to understand, propose, and deliver digital transformation solutions with emphasis on request fulfillment, automated workflows through ServiceNow Service Catalogs and key ITIL processes like Request, Incident, Problem, Change, Knowledge, and other modules.




Primary Responsibilities

 * Developing, configuring, and customizing the ServiceNow platform to fit business requirements.

 * Troubleshoot and resolve problems.

 * Responsible for the design and build of ServiceNow Applications and integration to other applications and platforms, including architecture, languages, best practices, and methodologies in an Agile Scrum environment.
 * Provide strong development and project on-track and on-task and collaborate on an ongoing project in both new and enhancements development between engineers, developers, analyst, and other team members.
 * Follow, maintain, and apply documentation best practice policies, procedures, and process throughout ServiceNow development.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to to gather input to support ongoing business needs for Service Now configuration, implementation, and support.
 * Review and apply any additional UI/UX requirements from external and internal team and align into ServiceNow development.
 * Utilizes available programming methodologies and languages and adhere to coding standards, procedures and techniques while contributing to the technical code documentation.
 * Support data migration as needed.
 * Design and implement solutions following established Configuration Management policies and standards.
 * Integrate data from multiple data sources into a unified CMDB, ensuring data quality and integrity are maintained.

Computer World Service (CWS) is a leading IT company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions for our customers and partners. We strive to deliver innovative solutions that optimize business processes and enhance organizational efficiency. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented and experienced ServiceNow Lead Engineer/Developer to join our dynamic team and drive the development and implementation of ServiceNow solutions.

As the ServiceNow Lead Engineer/Developer, you will play a pivotal role in leading the design, development, and implementation of ServiceNow solutions to meet business requirements and enhance operational efficiency. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including IT operations, business analysts, and stakeholders, to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions within the ServiceNow platform.

Key Tasks and Responsibilities

 * Lead the design and development of ServiceNow solutions, including configuration, customization, and integration with other systems.

 * Provide technical expertise and guidance to junior developers and team members to ensure high-quality delivery of ServiceNow solutions.

 * Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements, define scope, and prioritize projects.

 * Design and implement ServiceNow workflows, forms, reports, and dashboards to streamline business processes.

 * Conduct code reviews, performance tuning, and troubleshooting to optimize ServiceNow applications.

 * Stay abreast of ServiceNow platform updates, best practices, and industry trends to drive continuous improvement.

 * Serve as a subject matter expert on ServiceNow capabilities, providing guidance on platform architecture and configuration.

 * Develop and maintain technical documentation, including design specifications, deployment guides, and user manuals.

Job Requirements:

Education & Experience

 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.

 * Minimum of 7 years of experience in ServiceNow development and administration.

 * Proven experience leading the design and implementation of ServiceNow solutions in enterprise environments.

 * Strong proficiency in JavaScript, XML, HTML, CSS, and other web technologies.

 * Experience with ServiceNow modules such as Incident Management, Change Management, Service Catalog, and CMDB.

 * Solid understanding of ITIL processes and principles.

 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

Certifications

 * ServiceNow certifications such as Certified Application Developer (CAD), Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS), or Certified System Administrator (CSA) are preferred.

Security Clearance

 * Active DoD Secret (preferred).

Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.)

 * This position will be primarily remote in the DC area.

job_title: ServiceNow IT Service Management Developer, Hybrid
job_description:
Company Description


The University of Maryland Medical System is a 14-hospital system with academic, community and specialty medical services reaching every part of Maryland and beyond. UMMS is a national and regional referral center for trauma, cancer care, Neurocare, cardiac care, women’s and children’s health and physical rehabilitation. UMMS is the fourth largest private employer in the Baltimore metropolitan area and one of the top 20 employers in the state of Maryland. No organization will give you the clinical variety, the support, or the opportunities for professional growth that you’ll enjoy as a member of our team.


Job Description


General Summary

The ITSM Developer is responsible for working to develop and implement technical solutions on the ITSM platform for UMMS. The ITSM Developer will provide administration, application development, maintenance and technical support using best practice product programming techniques to configure robust solutions to the organization using the designated UMMS ITSM platform.

The ITSM Developer will work with a team of Healthcare professionals to deliver solutions involving all aspects of service delivery including ITIL Request, Incident, Problem, Change, Knowledge, Asset and other modules designed to automate and add meaningful value to the organization. The ITSM Developer will use software development methodologies best practices to conduct requirements analysis, system design, and play a vital role throughout the entire development lifecycle in a high velocity organization.

Principal Responsibilities and Tasks:

The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by Interns assigned to this classification. These are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified.

 * Work with both department and organizational stakeholders to research, analyze and implement enterprise-wide solutions/capabilities/enhancements to support the organization’s business/mission goals and objectives.
 * Create, maintain and enhance Incident Management, Problem Management, Service Request Management, Change Management, Service Catalog, Knowledge Management, Self-Service Portals, single sign on (SSO) capability, as well as integrations and workflows supporting operational integrity and ease of use.
 * Maintain Forms, Reports, Views, Workflows, Groups and Roles, including custom Roles when necessary
 * Coordinate application and platform upgrades, including robust and complete test models
 * Troubleshoot and resolve problems; Orchestrate and automate tasks
 * Design and develop solutions that leverage ITSM modules such as HR, ITSM, Discovery, CMDB, Knowledge and ITOM using configuration and custom JavaScript
 * Coach and train co-workers, and maintain working relationship to coordinate development and maintenance of the ITSM system
 * Lead discovery sessions and process definitions with stakeholders and developers
 * Develop Reports, Dashboards and analytical reports supporting business objectives and summarization of activities and trends


Qualifications


Education and Experience:

 * HS Diploma and 3+ years of experience as a ServiceNow Administrator/Developer in an enterprise environment.
 * 5+ years of experience in IT Service Management Process, Design and Administration (may include the 3+ years of experience as a ServiceNow Administrator/Developer
 * 3+ years of RESTful or SOAP web services
 * 3+ years of experience with HTML and JavaScript
 * 3+ years of experience with the key technologies relevant to ServiceNow integration solutions including: ServiceNow API’s, SSO, SAML, SSL, Web Services, LDAP, JDBC, ODBC, REST, SCP, FTPS
 * ServiceNow Certified Systems Administrator (CSA)

Note: Eligible candidates must possess all qualifications stated in 1. through 6. above.

Preferred Qualifications:

 * Bachelor’s degree in information systems, Business Administration, or related field
 * ITIL Foundations Certification
 * Agile Training/Certification
 * ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS)
 * ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD)
 * Asset Management Experience
 * ITBM Experience

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 * Strong demonstrated understanding of ITSM configuration process including health, maintenance, building and configuring UI policies, actions, scripts, pages and business rules
 * Strong demonstrated understanding of the ServiceNow platform and underlying modules
 * Strong demonstrated understanding of ITSM processes
 * Strong demonstrated ability to build tables, views, dashboards, UI navigation principles
 * Strong demonstrated ability to build complex workflow including the use of JavaScript and other configuration scripts in a ServiceNow environment
 * Strong demonstrated ability to define SLAs within the environment
 * Strong demonstrated ability to create/develop service catalog items, record generators, orders
 * Strong demonstrated ability to create reports and integrating them into distributed dashboards
 * Strong demonstrated analysis and problem-solving skills to assess the customer needs and determine appropriate solutions.
 * Strong demonstrated ability to create users, roles and maintain cost-effective and secure user management


Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job_title: ServiceNow Asset Management Developer – All Levels (Remote)
job_description:
As a Senior or Lead ServiceNow Asset Management Developer, you play a pivotal, technical leadership role in successfully deploying ServiceNow Software, Hardware, and Enterprise Asset solutions for our clients. In this role, you will be responsible for configuring, customizing, and implementing ServiceNow asset management—SAM Pro, HAM Pro, EAM—applications to meet specific business requirements. Your technical expertise, attention to detail, and commitment to excellence will contribute significantly to the success of our projects and the satisfaction of our clients.

Your responsibilities include:
 * Architectural Expertise: Design scalable, reliable, and high-performance ServiceNow solutions that meet both immediate project needs and long-term business goals.
 * Solution Configuration: Lead engagements with Solutions Architects and Business Analysts to understand the functional requirements and translate them into effective ServiceNow configurations. Configure and customize ServiceNow applications and modules to align with client's needs and industry best practices.
 * Innovation: Encourage innovation within the development team. Support the exploration of new technologies, methodologies, and processes that can enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the team's work.
 * Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop ServiceNow configuration test plans and validate functionality, data integrity, and user experience. Address any issues and perform necessary adjustments to ensure the solution meets the desired outcomes.
 * Data Migration: Develop and document data migration strategies and plans. Lead data migration activities from legacy systems to ServiceNow, ensuring data accuracy and consistency during the transition.
 * Integration Management: Design and document integration strategies and plans. Lead the integration of ServiceNow with other systems and applications to create seamless end-to-end processes.
 * Risk Management: Identify potential project risks and devise strategies to mitigate them. This includes considering factors such as security vulnerabilities, data privacy concerns, and potential integration challenges.
 * Incident and Problem Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to ServiceNow implementations. Lead the collaboration with support teams to provide timely resolution to incidents and problems.
 * Security and Compliance: Lead the adherence to security best practices and ensure that the team understands and implements solutions that meet relevant compliance requirements. Identify gaps in team knowledge and work with internal Practice leadership to resolve knowledge gaps.
 * Continuous Learning: Stay current with the latest trends, tools, and practices in the ServiceNow ecosystem. Lead personal and team development.
 * Corporate Growth: Contribute to the growth of the business. Lead the development of client roadmaps and solution demonstrations to identify and foster new opportunities for ICF services and ServiceNow license sales. Actively contribute to proposals (“bids”) for new opportunities, including oral presentations, written technical proposals, and reviews of such work.


Required Experiences and Certifications
Must possess one or more of the following, with relevant implementation experience to match:
 * ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist – Software Asset Management
 * ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist – Hardware Asset Management
 * Completion of Enterprise Asset Management for Implementers training on NowLearning

5 or more years of experience implementing ServiceNow solutions with hands-on experience (>6 months) configuring SAM pro, HAM pro, and/or EAM applications for clients.

Valuable Skills for this Role
The ideal candidate will also have:
 * Public trust clearance or eligible
 * Secret clearance or eligible
 * Experience in ServiceNow development and architecture.
 * Proficiency in scripting languages (JavaScript, GlideScript) and other relevant languages
 * Ability to design and lead complex integrations and workflows
 * Understanding of system architecture and design principles.
 * Strong leadership and team management skills
 * Exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities
 * Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills
 * In-depth understanding of ServiceNow best practices and industry trends
 * Conflict resolution skills to mitigate risks, resolve issues, and ensure timely and accurate delivery

Job Title: ServiceNow Developer



Position Overview:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced ServiceNow Developer to join our team. The ServiceNow Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining ServiceNow applications and solutions to support IT service management processes and workflows. The successful candidate will possess strong technical skills, a deep understanding of the ServiceNow platform, and experience in delivering high-quality solutions to meet business requirements.

Responsibilities:

 * Design, develop, and deploy ServiceNow applications and solutions to support IT service management processes such as incident management, change management, and service catalog.
 * Collaborate with business stakeholders, IT service managers, and other teams to gather requirements and define technical solutions.
 * Customize and configure ServiceNow modules, workflows, forms, and UI components to meet business needs.
 * Develop and maintain integrations between ServiceNow and other systems using REST/SOAP APIs, web services, and middleware platforms.
 * Implement and maintain ServiceNow CMDB (Configuration Management Database) to provide a single source of truth for IT assets and configurations.
 * Design and implement automation solutions using ServiceNow Orchestration, Flow Designer, and IntegrationHub.
 * Develop and maintain ServiceNow scripts, business rules, UI policies, and ACLs (Access Control Lists) to enforce security and governance policies.
 * Perform platform upgrades, patches, and performance tuning to ensure the stability, reliability, and scalability of the ServiceNow environment.
 * Provide technical guidance, support, and training to junior developers and team members.

Requirements:

 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
 * years of experience as a ServiceNow Developer or Administrator.
 * Strong technical skills in ServiceNow platform, including ServiceNow Development, ServiceNow Administration, and ServiceNow Integration.
 * Experience with ServiceNow scripting languages such as JavaScript, GlideScript, and AngularJS.
 * Proficiency in web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically and analytically.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
 * ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD) or ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA) certification is required.
 * Experience with ServiceNow ITSM (IT Service Management) and ITOM (IT Operations Management) modules is preferred.

Preferred Qualifications:

 * Experience with ServiceNow HR Service Delivery, Customer Service Management (CSM), or other ServiceNow modules.
 * Knowledge of ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) processes and best practices.
 * Experience with ServiceNow Performance Analytics and Reporting.
 * Familiarity with Agile and DevOps methodologies.
 * Experience with ServiceNow Service Portal and Widget development.

Overview:

Acuity, Inc. has an opening for a Senior ServiceNow Developer to support a critical government client. Are you a dynamic and creative individual who enjoys working in a collaborative environment for the development of sophisticated applications? Come check out Acuity!

Responsibilities:
The Senior Developer will work with a cross-functional team building unique solutions using ServiceNow. Specifically, you will:
 * Lead the design, development, and continuous improvement of enterprise solutions in ServiceNow.
 * Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of product requirements into solutions that acknowledge technical and schedule constraints.

 * Use out-of-the-box or value-added features to fulfill business requests and initiatives.
 * Perform workflow design, configuration, development, and data loads for ServiceNow platform applications.
 * Program workflow, enhancements, and integrations with ServiceNow platform applications.
 * Ensure solutions are secure, stable, and available to users.
 * Provide innovative solutions and ideas for process and platform automation.

 * Maintain technical documentation and mentor peers on ServiceNow best practices.
 * Perform advanced customizations including Business Rules, UI Pages, UI Macros, UI Scripts, Script Includes, Client Scripts, workflows, custom tables, reports etc.
 * Maintain technical expertise relevant industry standards and best practices in ServiceNow.
 * Led the successful migration of legacy data repositories to ServiceNow, ensuring data completeness, accuracy, and compliance with security standards.
 * Developed comprehensive data cleansing and normalization routines to improve the quality of legacy data before integration into ServiceNow.
 * Performed in-depth data analysis on legacy systems to identify dependencies, relationships, and potential migration challenges.
 * Troubleshot and resolved data integrity issues throughout the migration process, proactively mitigating risks.
 * Created thorough data migration documentation, including mapping tables, transformation rules, and validation procedures.

Qualifications:
 * Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.

 * At least eight (8) years of IT experience.
 * At least five (5) years of ServiceNow Development experience
 * Must be a ServiceNow Certified Application Developer or possess at least one (1) Certified Implementer Product Certification..
 * Must be a ServiceNow Certified Systems Administrator.
 * Experience with Agile Development and Test Management application frameworks

 * Experience with DevOps pipeline tools including configuration management, requirements (e.g., Jira), automated testing, and deployment.
 * Experience with developing and managing data models.

job_title: ServiceNow Developer-ITSM Change Management Workflow Customization
job_description:
IT IS A 4 MONTHS (16 weeks) REMOTE CONTRACT WITH POSSIBLE EXTENSIONS

ServiceNow Developer

Khoj Information Technology, Inc. is looking for a ServiceNow Developer to join our growing team. We are a fast-growing, client-facing team, and are looking for someone who is passionate about building great products and delivering high-quality customer service. It is 4 months' remote contract job with possible extension.

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced ServiceNow Developer with a strong background in ITSM Change Management Workflow Customization. As a ServiceNow Developer, you will play a crucial role in enhancing and customizing the ITSM Change Management process to meet the specific needs of our organization. You will be responsible for collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement robust solutions within the ServiceNow platform.

Responsibilities:

1.The primary responsibility of this role is to design, implement, and maintain seamless integrations between ServiceNow and Azure DevOps platforms

 * Configure, customize, and implement integration solutions using appropriate tools, APIs, middleware, and scripting languages to enable seamless communication and data flow between ServiceNow and Azure DevOps
 * Ensure that integration solutions adhere to security and compliance standards, safeguarding sensitive data and maintaining a secure environment
 * Proactively monitor integration processes, identify and resolve issues, and provide timely support to address any incidents related to the integration
 * Create detailed technical documentation, including integration specifications, user guides, and troubleshooting manuals, to facilitate knowledge sharing and enhance operational support
 * Looking for 8+ years of ServiceNow and 4+ years of Azure Devops experience

2. Customize ITSM Change Management Workflow: Utilize your expertise in ServiceNow to customize and enhance the Change Management workflow according to business requirements. Implement best practices and industry standards to optimize the change process.

3. Development and Configuration: Develop and configure ServiceNow modules, including Catalog Items, Business Rules, Client Scripts, UI Policies, and Notifications, to support efficient Change Management operations.

4. Integration and Automation: Integrate ServiceNow with other ITSM tools and external systems to enable seamless data exchange and automate change-related processes, minimizing manual interventions and enhancing productivity.

5. Incident and Problem Management Alignment: Collaborate with the Incident and Problem Management teams to ensure smooth coordination between processes, data sharing, and a holistic approach to IT service delivery.

6. User Experience Improvement: Continuously enhance the user experience of the ServiceNow platform for Change Management by implementing user-friendly interfaces and intuitive workflows.

7. Testing and Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough testing of developed solutions to identify and resolve any defects or issues. Ensure high-quality deliverables before deploying changes to production.

8. Documentation: Prepare comprehensive technical documentation, including design specifications, deployment guides, and standard operating procedures, to facilitate knowledge sharing and maintain system integrity.

9. Change Advisory Board (CAB) Support: Assist in CAB meetings, providing technical insights and recommendations to stakeholders for evaluating and approving changes.

10. Stay Updated with ServiceNow: Stay informed about the latest ServiceNow features, updates, and best practices. Proactively suggest improvements to current processes based on platform advancements.

Requirements:

1. ServiceNow Development Expertise: Proven experience as a ServiceNow Developer with a focus on ITSM modules and a deep understanding of Change Management workflow customization.

2. ITSM Knowledge: Strong knowledge of IT Service Management (ITSM) processes, especially Change Management, and how they align with ITIL best practices.

3. Scripting and Configuration: Proficiency in JavaScript, Glide API, and other ServiceNow-specific scripting languages. Knowledge of ServiceNow configurations and customization techniques.

4. Integration Skills: Experience in integrating ServiceNow with other ITSM tools and external systems through APIs, web services, and middleware.

5. Problem-Solving Abilities: Analytical mindset with a knack for identifying challenges and providing effective solutions to complex problems.

6. Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver successful projects.

7. Certifications (preferred): ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA), ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD), ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist - IT Service Management (CIS-ITSM).

FOR MORE INFO CALL KHURRAM AT 201 -677-1257 EXT 109 OR khurram"at"khoj-inc"dot'com

Job Summary
T he ServiceNow Developer reports to IT management and performs administration, reporting, configuration and ongoing maintenance of the ServiceNow platform; participates in the design, scoping and implementation of business and technology projects and provides insights about the system to management for ongoing improvements . The successful candidate will embody and work to reinforce MAA’s Core Values. Those values include:
Appreciating the uniqueness of each individual
Communicating openly and with integrity
Embracing opportunities
Doing the right thing at the right time for the right reasons

Duties and Responsibilities
Performs day-to-day administration of the ServiceNow system including initiating approved changes to the process and workflows; provides coaching to peers on system configuration and potential enhancements.
Performs ServiceNow implementation tasks including but not limited to: configuration, integration, testing, requirements gathering and solution design.
Develops clear and concise technical and process documentation making use of the knowledge base module within ServiceNow.
Partners directly with end users to resolve support issues within ServiceNow; identifies root causes of issues and assists with end user communications and knowledge bases.
Writes/creates coaching and process sheets to assist helpdesk personnel resolve current and future issues.
Builds/creates ServiceNow reports and dashboards; conducts analysis of issues, identifies trends and provides recommendations to management for ongoing process improvements.
Supports the design of ServiceNow integrations and assists with implementations through insights based on knowledge of the ServiceNow system.
Facilitates workflow enhancements to the ServiceNow application including automation and/or additional self-service features and functions.
Creates and/ or maintains the ServiceNow Sandbox environment for testing.
Creates and maintains procedures for moving items from the ServiceNow sandbox into the production instance.
Performs other related duties as assigned to meet the needs of the business.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and at least five years of experience as an IT service management (ITSM) software admin required, or equivalent combination of education and work required
At least one year of experience in ServiceNow development, configuration and administration required

Preferred Qualifications
Previous experience working closely within small team environments preferred

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Knowledge of ServiceNow best practices and ongoing awareness of latest ServiceNow features
Knowledge of the IIS Web Server and .Net application
Skill in data report building, data analytics, data mining, report generation and making recommendations
Skill in customer service orientation and written, verbal and interpersonal communication
Skill in translating technical information into terminology understood at all levels of users, both verbally and in writing
Skill in identifying and implementing process improvement opportunities
Skill in working in a team environment and divvying up assignments with team members
Skill in coaching peers on system configuration, use and process improvement
Skill in adapting and flexing to drive and support changing priorities

Physical and Environmental Requirements
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Disclaimer

Zoox is looking for a Senior ServiceNow Developer to own the technical implementation strategy and participate in product roadmap development. In this role, you will work hand-in-hand with the platform owner, ensuring alignment of technical solutions with business objectives as we roll out ServiceNow to Zoox Crew.


This role demands a deep understanding of ServiceNow, with strong Now platform knowledge with an emphasis on ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, third-party integrations, flow designer, and application development. Additionally, this role requires someone who has experience implementing ServiceNow from the ground up while driving platform adoption and trust through successful product releases.


IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

 * Lead a team of ServiceNow development-focused individuals
 * Establish and enforce platform development governance framework for internal and external teams
 * Act as a technical lead for the platform
 * Collaborate closely with the platform owner to design, develop, and refine ServiceNow functionalities, and ensure the platform performs seamlessly and meets business needs
 * Engage with stakeholders to create technical requirements documentation, and deliver consistent support
 * Dedicate time for continuous learning to remain updated with new ServiceNow modules and features, adapting to the company’s growth trajectory
 * Communicate technical information effectively to a wide variety of audiences at all organizational levels


QUALIFICATIONS:

 * 10+ years of experience working with ServiceNow or similar tooling with at least 5 years being in a technical architecture / design capacity
 * Deep understanding of ServiceNow solutions and implementation strategies
 * Subject matter expert in multiple modules including ITSM, ITOM, IntegrationHub, HAMPro, and SAMPro
 * Leadership capabilities and third-party vendor management experience
 * Certifications required include: Certified System Administrator and Certified Application Developer


BONUS QUALIFICATIONS:

 * Certified Technical Architect, Certified Implementation Specialist for ITSM, HAM, or Discovery

Compensation
There are three major components to compensation for this position: pay, Amazon Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), and Zoox Stock Appreciation Rights. The pay range for this position is $193,000 to $243,000. A sign-on bonus may be offered as part of the compensation package. Compensation will vary based on geographic location and level. Leveling, as well as positioning within a level, is determined by a range of factors, including, but not limited to, a candidate's relevant years of experience, domain knowledge, and interview performance. The pay range listed in this posting is representative of the range of levels Zoox is considering for this position.


Zoox also offers a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (e.g. sick leave, vacation, bereavement), unpaid time off, Zoox Stock Appreciation Rights, Amazon RSUs, health insurance, long-term care insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, and life insurance.
